summary: This is a child exploitation case status report dated March 24, 2021, listing cases assigned to a Lead AUSA. It includes summary entries for the cases against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, noting key dates like Epstein's arrest, indictment, and the dismissal of charges following his death, as well as Maxwell's indictment and superseding indictment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant in case 19-CR-00490, charged with alleged trafficking and enticement of minors. The document notes his arrest, indictment, and that the case was dismissed after his suicide.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in case 20-CR-00330, with charges listed under multiple statutes. The document notes a superseding indictment was filed against her.

connections.description: Both are listed as defendants in related child exploitation cases, with Maxwell's case following Epstein's.

events.title: Case Initiation for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Case entry for US v. Jeffrey Epstein under Public Corruption with Victim/Witness flag set to 'N'.

events.title: Appeal Withdrawn
events.description: The US Court of Appeals issued a mandate noting the parties filed a stipulation to withdraw the appeal in Epstein's case.

events.title: Dismissal of Epstein Case and Death
events.description: Charges against Jeffrey Epstein were dismissed without prejudice by the government following his suicide.

events.title: Case Initiation for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Case entry for US v. Ghislaine Maxwell under Public Corruption with Victim/Witness flag set to 'Y'.

events.title: Superseding Indictment for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A superseding indictment was filed against Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a status report for child exploitation cases (coded 080 or 087) assigned to a Lead AUSA, dated March 24, 2021.
It records that Jeffrey Epstein's case (19-CR-00490) was dismissed without prejudice on August 29, 2019, following his suicide.
It records the ongoing case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-00330), including a superseding indictment filed on March 29, 2021.
The report instructs AUSAs to close inactive cases promptly to focus on active supervision.
